result.execSummary:
The defendant Marc Ryan Lopit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marc R. Lopit in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Defendant Marc R. Lopit in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marissa James (victim) appears via phone.  State moved to amend count 2 in 16 CF 46 to straight DC.  Court grants motion to amend to DC w/o enhancer.  DE entered NC plea to 16 CF 46 and 16 CF 19.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant guilty 16 CF 19 and 16 CF 46.  Victim addressed the Court.

COURT:  
16 CF 46 (1) - 3 years prison - 18 months incarcerated and 18 months Extended supervision stayed consecutive to 16 CF 19 to complete 3 years probation consecutive of 16 CF 19-  costs $518.00 - eligible for challenge and substance abuse program- any conditions DOC may impose Probation is consecutive to count 2 and 16 CF 19
16 CF 114, 16 TR 220, 16 TR 221, 16 TR 650 and 16 TR 651 are dismissed and read-in

(2) - 90 days in custody consecutive to 16 CF 19 with huber - costs of $443.00 given 30 days to pay or set up payment plan
As per the request of Defense Attorney, Thomas W Duffy, the hearing set for June 23, 2016 has been removed from the Court's calendar.  mak

Defendant Marc Ryan Lopit in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Court entered NG pleas on MISD.  State makes stmt to the court re: Stop program (16 CF 19).  State requests modification of bond.   Atty Duffy waived time limits for preliminary exam.   Atty Duffy addressed the Court.  Hearing scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Combined with 16 CF 114, 16 CF 46 and 16 CF 19   Absolute sobriety - no contact with Marissa James.  Must provide a physical address where he will reside. Special Bail Bond Conditions for Operating while intoxicated
1.  Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages
2.  Defendant shall be subject to random testing of his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing.  Failure to report to the STOP program may result in the issuance of a warrant for the defendant's arrest, modification of bail, possible bail jumping charges and or forfeiture of bail.
